required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predicting Clinical Outcomes of Critically Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Predicting Clinical Outcomes of Critically Ill Patients in Intensive Care Units With De-identification Database

brief_summary.textblock: Australian and New Zealand Intensive Care Society (ANZICS) has built an Center of Outcome and Resource Evaluation (CORE) adult patients database (APD) of adult critically ill patients. ANZICS CORE APD has built an international collaboration of ICU database. National Taiwan University Hospital has joined this international collaboration and built the data according to the APD data dictionary with same value domain attributes and data element attributes. We retrospectively collected the data of patients discharged from the March 1, 2019 to March 20, 2020. This study aims to use the data to predict the clinical outcomes of these patients using statistical methods and machine learning.

primary_outcome.description: mortality status at 30 days after admission to intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: length of stay in intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of discharge from intensive care unit, a median of 2-7 days
secondary_outcome.description: number of days in intensive care unite

intervention.description: Critical care in the intensive care units

study_pop.textblock: Critically ill patients admitted to intensive care units

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Critically ill patients admitted to intensive care units
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients aged less than 20 years

patient_data.ipd_description: There is not a plan to make individual participant data available according to the regulation of research ethic committee of National Taiwan University Hospital.
